revised_title: Successful Extirpation of a Tumor in the Bladder
tldr: The author describes a case of a tumor growing inside the bladder that was successfully removed by Joseph Warner, a surgeon at Guy's Hospital. The patient, Mary Bevan, had been unable to urinate without the use of a catheter due to the tumor. Warner removed the tumor by securing it with a ligature and cutting the meatus urinarius to create more room for the procedure. After the operation, Bevan was able to urinate without assistance and fully recovered.
